name: Zenith Kuantan
detail: We are so happy stayed with Zenith although just a night. But after this night, we definitely will go back again and again for our upcoming Kuantan Trip. We spot Zenith is our favorite hotel in Kuantan,actually this is the best hotel and service that we had in Malaysia! I love the reception team and operation team,they are so lovely and cooperative! During our stay, we received an appreciate certificate from hotel's GM too. We are really happy to choose this hotel,never regret! The best memory in life with them!

name: Swiss-Belhotel Kuantan
detail: good Hotel location - just a few minuted drive to Kuantan Town. Lots of eating place nearby, even only walking distance to one of the best seafood restaurant in Kuantan! Great and fun swimming pools especially for the kids - swimming playground available at 5th floor. Enjoyable stay indeed. A warm greeting from the staff(s) here and there, but since the hotel is newly open, maybe it will take sometimes for them on the efficiency in services.

name: AC Hotel Kuantan
detail: I think this is one of the best hotel in Kuantan (at least in the city area). I've stayed a few times at other hotels including a 5 Star hotel (Zxx Hotel). This is my first time at Vistana Hotel and I'm so impressed. Better than the Zxx Hotel. Clean, quiet, good facilities including gym and pool, good breakfast and friendly staff. Definitely going to stay here again when I come to Kuantan.

name: Hyatt Regency Kuantan Resort
detail: I loved this resort for many reasons. For the first time in Malaysia, I loved the food in any resort or hotel. Here the food was simply awesome. The Buffet was expensive but has amazingly wide options. Didn't take breakfast here. Beach in front of resort is beautiful and clean. There are a few restaurants around the property. Staff was very polite and so helpful. For the first time ever in Malaysia, the staff could understand and speak English. Hyatt has kept their standard too the mark. Swimming pools are also nice and deep. Overall, we had a pleasant and relaxing holiday here. My family and I are going to visit again and again here to relax.

name: Shahzan Hotel Kuantan, Trademark Collection by Wyndham
detail: im staying here with my husband and my 1 year old son. the room is medium size for small family, but not suitable for family with more than 2 children. the room is clean, toilet is ok, not dirty. i chose this hotel because it has swimming pool and the room price is affordable. the pool not so clean, and the pool for children is not too suitable for baby less than 90 cm is think. my baby cannot sit inside the pool, the water level is too high. the location is very strategic, at the centre of Kuantan city. it is near Pasar Malam / night market located at UTC every Saturday night. and it is near mosque so for muslim, we can hear the azan very clearly. overall, i really love staying in this hotel. will stay here again if i come to Kuantan.

name: Hotel Sentral Kuantan @ Riverview City Centre
detail: first impression upon entering my room, it was a really clean and modern concept room. i've tried other boutique hotels in kuantan at similar rates and it was far worse than hotel sentral kuantan. equipped with lcd tv and fair amount of channels, in-room entertainment is good considering the room rates. there's complimentary wifi access as well. room is also spacious even for the smallest room available. one thing i didn't quite like was the bathroom tiles, they used dark blue tiles which doesn't quite help to give it a clean look and what's more there were reddish stains at the shower area. i hope the management can look into this, maybe in future renovations perhaps change to cleaner looking tiles. breakfast was included with my stay as well, although it does not offer a variety of food but it's good enough to fill your stomach and get your morning going. will definitely stay here again when i visit kuantan for my business trip!

name: Grand DarulMakmur Hotel Kuantan
detail: I have stayed here before many years ago. The standard rooms are huge (especially when compared to most new 4-star and 5-star hotels these days). The bathrooms are big with a full size bath and separate shower stall. My only gripe is that they have not refurbished the hotel for many years (everything seems to be the same when I last stayed here over 10 years ago). For instance, my room had a carpet burn (from a dropped iron), the wooden furniture is scuffed and looks really used. A discerning type traveler may not like this. The hotel also seems to be somewhat dead from its F&B aspect. The first night I was there (Saturday), I found the Chinese restaurant only opened at 7.30pm and on my last night (Monday), the Chinese restaurant was closed. The principal F&B restaurant (Senja) serves a fairly decent buffet breakfast, with standard western and asian selections but again I was startled to discover that it was closed at night. (I did not order any room service then, but I wonder if the kitchen was operating at night). I feel a little depressed since when I was last here, it was a very nice place to stay in, now it looks rather dreary and if no attempt is made to give it a facelift or refurbishment, I suspect it will go down the drain especially since a couple of newcomer hotels in Kuantan can give it a run for its money.

name: Vivo Hotel By KR Cosmos Sdn Bhd
detail: Stayed here for business purpose for 3 days. overall the place has all the amenities and service you would hope for, given the price range. It is cleaner than some hotels I've been to in Kuantan and that's probably because it is new/refurbished. overall good experience!

name: Cathayana Hotel Kuantan
detail: Hotel Cathyana the best hotel in Kuantan. Everything excellent. If we went to kuantan Cathyana is our best choice to stay. So...if you want to stay in harmony with your family Hotel Cathyana is the best place. Happy family and Have a nice dream...😍😍😍

name: E-Red Hotel Kuantan
detail: Good location for budget hotel in Kuantan, walking distance to the nearby food court, and opposite professional massage center, plenty of parking spaces.
